name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: What an amazing park. Don't know where to start staff was awesome. Bathrooms where so clean. Loved the swimming. The other campers where so friendly.  Definitely going back next season.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The best part about the park is access to the lake. It's beautiful and shallow. Lovely place for families. We were camping close to the highway and it was loud. If you can't get a spot right on the lake, don't go. Those spots are quieter.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: I give the camp ground a 5, it's very nice.  Right on the water and beautiful.  Clean showers and baths. Sites are smaller than I expected but there is so much waterfront to explore it didn't matter to us. Went with my 2 kids. Had a site ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: My friends and I stayed 5 days here this past week and we loved it. Even though we were right by the highway we found it easy to tune out any noise coming from it. The beach was beautiful and we were able to watch some beautiful sunsets. ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Our site is right on the water. Amazing sound of the waves. Not a lot of privacy which we semi fixed with the set up of our trailer and truck. We are right in the middle of where the facilities are so we have the longest walk to the washrooms. Site 196.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Nice spot for 1 or 2 days camping. Access to water is there but a regular beach is under 3 min drive away. 
Sunrise and sunset was amazing to watch if the day is clear.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Don't expect a private campsite - this is not a wilderness park. Go for the waterfront. It's beautiful slate rock shelves stretching out into Georgian Bay. If you love being on or in the water, there's nothing better than this park.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Great park to visit. Seems smaller than it is. Lots of beautiful shoreline to explore and beautiful sunrise and sunsets! Staff are friendly and courteous. Amenities are reasonably close by. Not all sites have much privacy though.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Clean but pretty small. We came around 11 pm, so nobody wasn't here to sell some firewood, but it was bunch of bags left on the corner. We took one and paid in the morning. Thankful for that!

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Very nice campground.   Large pull through sites.  Staff very friendly.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Definitely not a campground for an extended vacation, more suited to someone just stopping in for a night on route to somewhere else. The park is very small, the sites are tiny and although we thought our site in Area C was lacking in ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: We had an excellent stay! Site #12 was perfect for us with a lovely water view. We'll definitely be back! Thank you!

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Went camping over the weekend. The camp site, especially the washrooms and showers, are clean and well maintained. The camp sites are close to each other and the privacy is minimal. No sand beach and the rocks make it hard to go inside the lake. Overall, it was a nice experience.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
This park is really small and its wedged literally between  the shore of Georgian Bay and Hwy 26.
Half the park has amazing tree sites the other half is almost treeless and some of the sites are ignorantly small.  
Still the views and seeming is amazing and kids can find fossilized bones very easily.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: If you are at blue mountains or wasaga beach, you must visit this place. I visited this place twice and loved to visit again and again. Best place for yoga too üòÇ

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Beautiful view, staff were very accommodating and friendly. But the campsites are so small and close together our trailer barely fit on it. We pulled in and back out again and headed home. Very unfortunate.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Great park! Camping is close to the road, but nice facilities. Beach is nice to cool off.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The sound of the water at night was beautiful. Bring water shoes! There's oddly alot of roads here, we heard alot of traffic. The place could use more trees as well. Love how close it is to other fun things like the scenic caves

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Small camping site with big views and even friendlier people. This was our second time going to craigleith and this time my boyfriend and I just went by ourselves for an overnight trip. Site staff were very friendly when we had a concern ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Very beautiful camp ground! There isn't really a large beach and some trees are still small so not a lot of privacy between camp sites! Just a short 10 min drive to blue mountain village!

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nice small park but close to a busy road

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: We had a nice day trip here with family. Great view! Crystal clear water .. 3 stars due to the picnic tables placed right on the shoreline making the beach look very ugly!

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The views of Georgian Bay were hard to beat. Sunsets : take your breath away! The only downside was the description of our campsite. It was listed as full shade and this was inaccurate. Unless of course you consider 1 large Charlie Brown ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Amazing i would 100% come back here. Cute little beach, they have a shop on the campground that way if you forget small items they have them. Bathroom and showers are very clean which im happy to say. 
Not too far from any town for ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nice facilities, very clean. Lack of beach and very busy highway made our stay less enjoyable.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: A place to pitch a tent and sleep if all other campgrounds are booked solid. Then you may want to consider a motel or hotel.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Clean park with nicest swimming around. Water is super clean. Campground has a little noisy from highway traffic.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Sites close to the slate beach is excellent.   The rest of the spots are  a touch crowded and lacking in foliage. Showers are excellent.  Location is close to the local beach and town.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Sadly.. my favourite place on the planet was ruined by a wind storm knocking over several trees!! üò™ but what was worse was how they let every site have like 15 tents on it and felt over run with people..  looked like a makeshift homeless community. üò™üò™

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Stayed there for 3 days. Make sure to put parking permit on the car display board. This park's parking lot is a cash cow for the town of wasaga beach police. They will make no. of visits to this parking lot every day. Camp sites are cramped. Park is ok.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: We camped on site 12 very close to the water. This helped to mask other bothersome noise. There isn't much coverage or foliage between many sites but the park does offer a nice playground and field for kids. There isn't a beach but lots ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Was a bit disappointed at the campground.  The sites are small and crowded. Not a good spot for swimming. Very close to the highway.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Very nice park. Clean and quiet.  Highly recommend

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Terrible park.
No where to park truck and trailer to check in.
Controlled entrance which is a pain.
Sites are small and roads are narrow.
Site was very dirty.
Rude and ignorant people everywhere.
We had booked 2 nights and left after 1.
Will never ever return.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Beautiful location on Lake Huron. Unfortunately neighbors a highway. Not much privacy.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nice small park to go camping and fossil hunting. $15 parking inside or outside flat rate.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Really fun place to pay for day use and Wade around looking at fossils in the bracing beautiful waters.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The. Worst. Park. Ever.  Highway 26 traffic noise is ridiculous and offensive all the time except for about 3 in the morning.  You can SEE the vehicles on the highway, not just hear them.  Campsites?  What sites?  Reminiscent of a camp ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Went to there shale beach;place was awesome,but we are trying to keep it a secret.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: I really liked that i could wake up take 20 steps and be in the water. I did not like that there is very little tree coverage and the highway is very close to the campground you can hear vehicles going by.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Favourite place for a swim. Very clear water.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: No real beach at this park but otherwise pretty good

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Pretty waterfront and friendly campers. Unfriendly kids working in the office.  Don't bring a trailer longer than 24' here unless you like driving it in the bush.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Lots to do and see in the area . Staff were very friendly and easy going . Lucky us the weather was great as well .

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: It was very small. Peaceful, but I probably won't be back, unless for a quick stop on my way to somewhere else.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Love it, washrooms accesabale, drinking water taps available, direct acces to Lake, they run various nature programs.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: My boyfriend & i and our 2 dogs camped on site 20 which in our opinion was one of the nicest! It has a great view of georgian bay and its right across from the pet exercise area (smaller than what it looks like on the campsite map). The ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: If you go here because its a Provincial Park, you will end up pretty upset. If you here to crash for a night, it's ok. There are no hiking / biking trails, no privacy, no water sport, right by hwy 26 which is very loud overnight. No bugs even in mid July. Showers are clean.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: We stayed at the campground and i cannot recommend it enough for its beauty.  One has tp expect a little noise from the road, but it is drowned out by the waves if you take a camping spot next to the water.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The best park with the cleanest water you'll find! Worth the 2 hour drive!!

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: It's cool to have a place with fossils so easily accessible.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Very beautiful site, water view and amazing sunsets, excellent customer service, clean and very well maintained. Will return to this campsite for sure.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
user: my name is tyler and i am a youtuber
review: It waz really small and there was no privacy. And the place reeked of weed.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Great get away park.  Highway a little noisy but okay at night for sleeping

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: No privacy anymore after the storm last year. Park wardens are also fairly strict as they usually are at Ontario parks. Good place to stay if you're looking to do downhill biking at Blue on a budget though. Would highly recommend for that. Quick 20 minute ride to the hill.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: N8ce park on the water. Some sites have direct water for trailer nice bonus

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: It was a beautiful campground.  Noisy though due to hwy 26

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: What a cozy park

name: Craigleith Provincial Park

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Good campsites, good privacy but noisy either from the nearby highway or from the lake waves

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Worse provincial park i have ever seen. Lots are tiny and zero privacy.  Refused to stay.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The staff were friendly and the water in the facilities was hot, but the positives end there. The campsites are wide open (virtually no trees to separate sites for privacy), it's is very close to a main road with frequent traffic noise, ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Ridiculously small sites. The highway noise is bothersome, especially at night when trucks go by

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Its extremely near the water. The water was so clean that you can see your feet clearly and the flat rocks going in a row. Camping is possible here and has a small play ground also. Shower and washrooms and a store to buy firewood and ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: I had a great time there ;P

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nkce place, enjoyed my time there, clean place

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: This park maintains the same standards I have experienced at other provincial parks. The park is smaller then most, due to its location being between a major highways and Georgian Bay shoreline. The overall noise level of traffic is also ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: The park is a thin slice on the shore of Georgian Bay, with a beautiful easily accessible flat shale rock coast. We found it a great spot to sit and watch the sunrise, but it would also be a great spot to launch a canoe or kayak.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Great park right on Georgian Bay. Like, our camp site was like 10 meters from the shore with clear views of the water. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the park was clean, and sites were a good size. 

The sites weren't very ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nice little park, too close to main road (highway)

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
My partner and I are huge provincial park fans and camp as often as we can, but Craigleith is hard to love. Easy to like, but it's definitely hard to love. 

While we had a beautiful site (155) right on the water, there is no privacy as ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: We stopped by just to see how it is, well it is not for us. Too close to the road(highway), too close to your neighbor. But you are really close to the water.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: GREAT camping experience with wonderful staff.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: No shade at campsite and lots of noise from nearby hwy 26.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Nice camping area, not a great beach very stones. The ranger was very helpful. Great area to be if you wish to experience the Colingwood area

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Windy and stoney  ground, the beach breeze was to strong to go boating.  Maybe just wrong timing as this was almost fall season.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
We camp here for the location as it is fairly close to Wasaga Beach and Blue Mountain trails. It is not like the "in town" private camps, which I preferred when I was "younger"
I generally prefer provincial parks because I know I will ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: It is an Ok park if you do not want to travel far, the sites are small and no privacy. The beach...well I wouldn't call it a beach...too many rocks..

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Great location on the water. Park staff are excellent. Very friendly and helpful. Washrooms and showers are clean. Park is located on a busy highway so there is road noise, but most of the time during our stay the sound was muffled by ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: I wouldn't want to camp there. The camp ground was very open. Not much foliage of any kind to separate the sites from one another. The sites were small and not well defined. We drove around the entire campground and this was the case ...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: 2 stars for being right on Georgian Bay and staff were friendly. Loss of stars for the fact that the sites are extremely open (they do explain this on their website)and the washrooms and basic upkeep were less than OK. Good for a one night pit stop as well as to see the sunset on the bay.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Beautiful views from beach front campsites. Some sites seemed small, but ours (site 9) was perfect for our three tents (one large and two small). At times the highway is audible, but is generally overpowered by the relaxing waves.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Not a lot of privacy but on the lake

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Excellent place! The rocks were very neat! Just be careful not to slip and fall while swimming, because the rocks tend to sometimes be rather slippery...

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: It's very close to Blue Mountain where we had an event to go to. That was the only reason we went there and probably the only reason we will go back to it again. Not the usual Provincial park feel. Sites are nice, but, too close to the road to my liking

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: If you don't mind to sleep with loud noise from Highway 26, or sounds of Georgian Bay,   it is still a good place to visit and camp.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Great spot to stop for a few hours. You can find tons of fossils in the shale and the rock "tiers" are a warm spot to sun yourself by the shoreline.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: A small but beautiful park. It is especially nice during the fall season with the Georgian Bay waters providing a symphony of tranquility to go with the picturesque skies and scenery. One of my favourite parks.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: Camping by the water.   Very carefully maintained campground.   Great employees

review: It has nice beach but camp ground is smaller than other provincial parks and privacy is worse than other parks. also  it is too close to local road and lots of noise from it.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Good place for swimming for kinds and adults. 
It has "flat rock" shore which gradually goes to water without sudden deep holes. Water warms up very well and water is quite clear. 
Good for snorkeling and diving training.  
The bad thing, - it is next to highway 26. Noisy.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review: A nice small park to take the kids and discover fossils embedded in shale.

name: Craigleith Provincial Park
review:
Great place for romantic getaway.
It's better if you visit during summer time.
Always best to have heater if going during cold season.
Try to get a place with electricity.
